title: You changed "ADC" to "Marksman"
body:
You may want to think about changing the name "support" to something else. Maybe Strategist or whatever. 

1. In an already highly toxic community, you've got people who see "support" and read "lap dog." It's usually these players that lead to the most losses. 
2. It deters people from playing the role. I don't mind that, I get insta-games in TB, but it's not good for the game overall. If "Support" was a champ, it would be due for a rework
3. The other issue I keep seeing is that supports are pigeon-holed in the mind of the player base. A classic example is Gangplank. His secondary role is "support" - the game lists him as that. He also has a pretty decent kit for supporting, and when I queue up in TB as a support GB I kicked religiously. 

I want to repeat myself here to make a point. **When I take a game-listed support champ, with a solid support kit, in a position that's in demand, and will cut down on their queue time by 5 to 10 minutes - they still choose to wait. ** That might involve other elements, but the primary one is this "Gangplank can't CC things for me to get fed. Not a support. Kick him."

And you can safely guess that this is a person who doesn't play support often. Personally, I don't care. I'm getting another game in 5 seconds. Hell, kick me from the next 10 games, I'm still getting to play well before your 4 are. (or 40, as it were). But this isn't about me. It's about the game, and this small change could help in bridging the gap between those of us who know how to win, and the arrogantly uninformed.

replies.body:
It really is unfortunate that the term "Support" has become so twisted and meaningless that it applies to **anyone** who can go bot and get the marksman fed. (Such as "Support" Annie or "Support" Fiddlesticks who are really just Mages with powerful point and click CC.)

In my mind there are three requirements for a Support.

1. Can heal an ally. (Soraka, Sona, Taric)
2. Can sheild an ally. (Oriana, Morgana, Lux)
3. Can buff an ally. (Nami, Janna, Lulu)

Notice how Leona isn't on there. The only thing she does to directly "support" her team is with her passive's bonus damage. Which isn't the reason she's picked.

Oriana is more of a Support than Leona even though she's primarily mid. Ori can sheild an ally, speeding them up while slowing nearby enemies before causing a huge displacement AoE.

I'm just not sure what else we could call people like Soraka to help the community better understand the class.

By the strict definition, a support is any champion that provides utility to the team that doesn't particularly need gold to scale. Any champion with strong cc will fit that definition, even if you don't consider them supports, as well as those that heal, shield, and "buff". 

Also using that definition, I don't see a particular problem with renaming the support role to the "utility" role.

Actually, all champions need gold to scale.

I will only go towards champions that say they are supports, so champions like {{champion:53}} who are not supports at all or champions like {{champion:89}} who are secondaries will not count.

From the ones I have:

{{champion:40}} has no real power except in poke. Her Q has been nerfed to crazy extremes. And her major heal is not at all as good as Soraka's. I for one think its wrong and irrational to nerf a support like Janna this much. She now relies on major AP items to be able to help any.

{{champion:20}} is by far, one of the most unique of his time, supports who can actually support very well. He has only been untouched because of his role *in the jungle* and by far now seems like a worthy choice for support. He doesn't need much like the others to go in and do good damage and stay alive at the same time. His passive was also reused on Lissandra of all things.

{{champion:16}} is the saddest to see nerfed because of her immensely useful kit. Her nice heals and mana regen E made her one of my favorites when supporting. But, now after the change, she is too easy to kill. Uses up too much mana and sacrifices too much of her own life. But at least she has 2 damaging spells.

{{champion:44}} is possibly coming in close 3rd or 4th on the support scale. His heals now match those of his competitors and he gives a lot of nice bonus' to his allies. But he needs a lot of AP/health/armor that are not cheep. He also has the most squishy early game and is the hardest to use because of this.

{{champion:26}} got hit HARD by the nerfs Riot gave. His only attack was nerfed to go up to 320. If my opponent just gets {{item:3027}}, they're safe because they get 650 health that blocks the 640 damage I'd give. That means, I have to build only large AP items. But, now {{item:3128}} isn't even in Summoner's Rift anymore. So much for that scaling item.

Riot's nerfs to {{champion:37}} have made so many angry. Yet, she is still played more than Lulu or Nunu support.

By the way, there are only 10 out of 122 champions that are supports. (And again, I mean it must say they are support and not the secondary.)

I started trying to go through these one by one, but you make the same mistake for every champion. Supports aren't supposed to be built to deal damage or be Maokai. I think you would have a lot more success if you stopped trying to do that. Max Janna's E, don't bring nunu, Raka needs health not AP, build CDR on the other ones. 

Zilean is the only champion you listed that there's an argument for building damage on.  And even then he's better off maxing CDR and making full use of his ult and movement speed to ward all the time. By the way, starting Seraph's embrace on him is so OP.

I mean you could definitely build them like they're just solo laners. People do it all the time. But that doesn't make them as good supports.

Here's how I see things. Every champion has a Class and a preferred Role.

Class: Two attributes define what they DO, Melee/Ranged and Single/AoE

Fighter - Single Target Melee - Primarily auto attacks - Fizz, Akali, Master Yi, J4, Yorick, Udyr, Shaco, Nocturne

Tank - AoE Melee - Primarily ability based - Amumu, Sejuani, Zac, Singed, Galio, Rammus, Leona.

Marksman - Single Target Ranged -  Primarily auto attacks - Caitlyn, Vayne, Ashe, Graves, Lucian, Varus, Miss Fortune.

Mage - AoE Ranged - Primarily ability based - Veigar, Anivia, Annie, Soraka, Janna, Sona, Lissandra

----------------

Role: Not what they do, but HOW they do it.

Assassin - Slippery get in, kill, get out - Shaco, Nocturne, Akali, Fizz.

Disruptor - Forcibly creates openings - J4, Amumu, Gragas, Sejuani, Leona, Thresh, Trundle

Support - Increases the power of their allies - Soraka, Janna, Nami, Taric, 

[Carry(?) - (Not really sure what to label people who are just about causing lots of raw damage with no fancy tricks. Ex. Brand and Annie)]

I came up with that in 5 min. Surely Riot can do better?

-----------------------

Jarvan: Fighter - Disruptor
Trundle: Fighter - Disruptor
Akali: Fighter - Assassin
Fizz: Fighter - Assassin
Master Yi: Fighter - Assasin
Orianna: Mage - Support
Soraka: Mage - Support
Janna: Mage - Support
Leona: Tank - Disruptor
Braum: Fighter - Disruptor

An example of this "trinity" in action.

Braum **Disrupts** the enemy team with his R (Glacial Fissure) and prevents counter fire with his E (Unbreakable). Nocturne jumps in and **Assassin**ates the enemy Marksman. Orianna covers him, **Support**ing his dive with her shield and powerful CC to prevent his target from escaping.

(I view Orianna as a Support as her Q is slower than allowing a team mate to carry the ball for you.)

I like this idea a lot more than just "strategist". It would probably need a lot of fine tuning to best define who is what (for instance, emphasize that tanks are super durable, while emphasizing that fighters under this definition aren't), but this or a similar system would be much more helpful as a quick reference to figure out how somebody plays best than what we have now.

The original support designs actually had quite high AP ratios.  Janna, for example, had 0.75AP on Q, 1.0AP on W, 1.0AP on E, and 1.0AP on R.  It was only later that Riot rebalanced the support class for 0cs play.

You're confusing Support *position* and Support *role*.

Support position is "the guy who goes bot and gets the marksman fed."
Support role is the shield/heal/buff utility person.

It's a common issue for people who play mainly SR (and TT, to a lesser extent). The ADC/Support positions are so deeply entrenched in the meta that where a champion goes gets mixed up with what a champion contributes to the team. There was a Riot post about a year and a half ago that goes into this a little further. 
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=39858469

In this sense, yeah, Riot should rename the role to avoid confusion with the position.

The confusion is that Support exists both as a *role* ("champion class/type") and as a *position* (what you called a "role").

Position defines where you go (e.g. mid, top, jungle).
Role defines what you contribute to the team (e.g. damage through auto-attacks, damage through ranged abilities, beefy frontline).

As you said, Leona is a Tank role played in the Support position. She functions as a beefy frontline in fights, yet goes around warding and protecting the ADC during laning. In contrast, Sona would be a Support role played in the Support position. She's definitely not a beefy frontline; instead she buffs the team while disrupting the enemy. However, she also goes around warding and protecting the ADC during laning.

Riot could probably help resolve some of the confusion by simply renaming the Support role to differentiate from the Support position. Unfortunately, the "ranged auto-attacker" also suffers from role/position confusion, but since "Marksman" is officially a role, "ADC" can sorta be used as a makeshift position label.

But, for example, a Marksman can go top to counter a melee lane bully, and still be a marskman, while for adc is usually intended a champion that goes botlane ,shares that lane and tries to farm as best as he/she can for the lategame costant damage output.

I think that's what I said.

"Marksman" is a *role* describing champions that deal damage primarily through ranged auto-attacks. "ADC" is a *position* for a champion that goes bot, shares the lane, and farms for late-game.

As I mentioned, it's confusing due to overlap. ADC position is almost always occupied by a Marksman, but a Marksman doesn't always have to go to the ADC position. Quinn would be an example of one that goes top to counter a melee.

In my mind, there are a lot more than 3 things of shields, heals, and buffs, that would qualify as support things.

1. Vision.  (Wards, abilities that grant vision of enemy units, and summoned units like Tibbers can even give vision)
2. Shields.  (Eye of the storm, face of the mountain, etc.)
3. Heals. (Astral infusion, Ebb and Flow, etc.)
4. Mana restoration - Although this has been removed from the game entirely (Previous Soraka's infuse)
5. Buffs (Sona's auras, aegis, etc.)
6. Debuffs, although this one is kinda vague.  But I do think using something like exhaust is a support thing.  Why does it matter so much if it's lowering their damage vs increasing your ally's defense?
7. Cleanse (Mikael's, QSS, and of course, Cleanse)
8. Denying enemy vision (Sweepers, vision wards, other true sight, or any other ways of destroying their wards)
9. Gold income (Targon's Brace)
10. Mobility (Thresh's lantern)
11. Denying enemy attacks (Black shield, wind wall, body blocking, etc.)

I personally would not count CC.  CC is a different thing than support IMO and generally serves very different purposes than any of the things I listed above.  My list is all about helping teammates survive, get stronger, and be able to win fights by relying on their own strengths and abilities.  CC is more like you caught an enemy and then they're just a free kill for someone on your team.  A carry could kill them without even needing any of their abilities.  If I could make up my own list of all the types of champions, it's be something more like:

Bruiser Tank - Guys like darius and garen that are tanks but also designed to do some pretty good damage even in short amounts of time.
CC Tank - Champions like Sion or Leona that are tanks but still help win fights by keeping enemies CC'd a lot, not necessarily by doing much damage.
Burst Mage - Mage like leblanc or katarina that does a lot of damage over a short period of time, although not necessarily very high dps over a long period of time.
DPS Mage - Mage like Ziggs, Vel'Koz, Xerath, or Karthus that, given enough time, can do a whole lot of damage to enemies.
Assassin - Physical damage dealer version of a burst mage.  Someone like Talon or Zed.
ADC / Marksman - Ranged physical version of a DPS Mage that tries to maximize damage per second using physical attacks.
ADC / Melee - Melee physical version of a marksman.  For guys like Master Yi that, although he could be considered an assassin, I say he should be something different.  Because his dps does not end after defeating one enemy.  He can wipe out their entire team faster than a marksman if given the chance.  I don't know exactly what this class should be called but I feel like it should exist.
Fighter - Somewhere between a bruiser and an assassin.  Not a tank, but not someone that can insta kill enemies, either.   But still generally very good at fighting 1v1 and good offense and good defense.  Someone like Jax.
Traditional Support - Does any decent amount of the 11 things mentioned above.  Soraka, Sona, etc.
CC Support - Well, the only thing that's left.  A champion that isn't a CC tank but still relies a lot on CC.  Basically any of the supports that have CC abilities that they plan to use on enemies reasonably often.  Most of what they do lies in their other abilities.  But some other supports, like Nami, Janna can potentially have their opponents CC'd quite a lot of the time.

Some champions are more than one type obviously, but I think I could fit every champion in the game into these, with giving most of them a secondary.  And it would be a pretty good description of what they do.

I'd argue a lot of your things actually make Supports **harder** to define. Manly in that you include a lot of items that non-Support champions can and will buy.
